title: We need Summoner Rift's skins based on regions.
body:
Since the SR is the map layout that works best, one of the best solution for diversity is simply to make map skins instead of new maps that don't work as much/aren't as popular as Summoner's Rift.
######(Hello Twisted Treeline and Crystal Scar)
Since Runeterra's visuals are being more and more developed, the best inspiration for skins that still correlate with the game are the different regions.
In addition, players have expressed their desire to bring back the Crystal Scar and the Butcher's Bridge not only because it was in different and/or beloved game modes but also because they liked to play in a different environment than usual.

Seriously, imagine the SR in, say, Bilgewater, having some of the Butcher's Bridge's assests such as turrets, inhibitors, nexuses or even the shopkeepers.
The map is the dangerous docks of Bilgewater at night. The jungle are the dark back-streets with only few lanterns to light them.
The jungle monsters are replaced as well, Razorfins takes the place of Wolves, Raptors become Wharf Rats or even Nagakabouros instead of the Baron Nashor.

And digging a bit into what's been released in the Universe Website, any region is adaptable.

EDIT: Also, it would be one more good way to introduce the game's lore to neophytes.

replies.body: This would add a new level of immersion to the game. I would definitely be up for this, especially for the more "environmental" areas like Shurima and the Freljord.

Fucking yes please.

That said, there could be clarity issues (Such as color and map design messing with player perception) so for ranked, I'd strictly keep it SR.
Seems fair.

They really should. We've gotten some variety through ARAM's Howling Abyss and Butcher Bridge (make it part of a regular rotation, you cowards!), but it feels like such a waste having an expanding world with impressive designs that isn't represented outside of champions. Summoner's Rift with a Piltover vs Zaun aesthetic would be resonant with the lore of them being the same city; an Ionian countryside bearing the scars of Noxus' invasion; Shuriman desert touched by the Void.

It would be a massive undertaking. Wurf though.

I thought about it and wanted to work on it ( although i'm not quite good with backgrounds but I was ok to try it....even if it would take me forever )

I seriously wanted to propose that kind of stuff, except I thought it that way :

- All regions would be a skin of Summoner's Rift : Demacia, Noxus, Ionia, Frejlord, Bilgewater, Shurima, Targon, The Shadow Ilses, Piltover, Zaun, The Void, Bandle City...
- The skin would be determined by the number of champions coming from this region in each team. ( mostly demacians champions = Demacia Skin, and so on )
- Adding custom music for each Region
- It would be an option to keep Summoner's Rift basic skin
- Adding interactions for each Region ( Demacian champions would comment on Noxus, Zaunites would "bash" Piltover.... anything related to the lore or how they feel about the Region itself )
- Adding customs skins for the objectives ( Baron, Dragons, Turrets, Monsters in the jungle )
- Adding customs Announcer Voices depending on the current Region ( could be just an announcer that fits the Region such as a tone in their voice, an accent that makes you feel like the announcer is from the Region, or a champion of the Region )
- Adding unique visuals for each Region ( a crowd of soldiers, blood, banners for Noxus, Raptors Riders, overwhelming light, a grand plaza like base for Demacia, stained glass, steams of toxic runoffs, overwhelming technology in Zaun, classy buildings, hextech technology, fine markets for Piltover....and I could go on )

Hope this thread will be seen by Riot!
